q: Sen. Bernie Sanders John Carney, D-Del., also plans to vote for repeal when the proposal comes to the House, said spokesman James Allen. Tom Carper said Delaware business owners "made a good point," but there's more than one way to fix those concerns. He supported a different repeal measure last week that would have been financed by eliminating tax loopholes for oil and gas companies. That measure failed. Following are analysts' comments on his decision and its implications for Prime Minister David Cameron : LABOUR PARTY LEADER ED MILIBAND Labour has been saying for some months that there are real questions about Andy Coulson 's ability to do his job given the cloud of allegations hanging over him. We think he should have gone earlier. He has now done the right thing. I think there are questions about David Cameron 's judgement, about hanging on to him as long as he did.
